alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Dillon; Florence; Marlboro; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 7:29PM EDT until April 05 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Florence County in northeastern South Carolina... Southwestern Dillon County in northeastern South Carolina... Central Darlington County in northeastern South Carolina... Southern Marlboro County in northeastern South Carolina... Western Williamsburg County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 729 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles south of Elliott to near Holly Hill, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Florence, Lake City, Darlington, Kingstree, Timmonsville, Lamar, Quinby, Mars Bluff, Brownsville, Lydia, Cades, Darlington Raceway, Swift Creek, Cartersville, Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus, Oats, Hebron, New Hope, Trio and Salters. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern South Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern South Carolina.
